faq.description: In this section you will find answers to the most common questions about the activities of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova.

questions.question: What are the main activities of the center?
questions.answer: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova carries out activities in the following key areas: development and implementation of innovative medical technologies, expert-analytical support of the healthcare system, research activities in the field of public health, as well as methodological support for the implementation of state healthcare programs.

questions.question: How to apply for participation in a research project?
questions.answer: To participate in a research project, you need to submit an application through the center's official website by filling out the appropriate form. The application should include a resume, motivation letter and a brief description of your interest in a particular project. After reviewing the application, our specialists will contact you to further discuss cooperation opportunities.

questions.question: What documents are required to submit a cooperation application?
questions.answer: To submit a cooperation application, the following documents are required: an official letter with a cooperation proposal, description of the project or cooperation direction, copies of the organization's registration documents, contact details of responsible persons. Documents can be sent through the official website or by email.

questions.question: How can I get consultation from center specialists?
questions.answer: To get consultation from center specialists, you can leave a request on the website, send a request by email or call the specified contact phones. The request must indicate the topic of consultation and the preferred method of communication. Our specialists will contact you shortly.

questions.question: Does the center conduct educational programs and trainings?
questions.answer: Yes, the center regularly conducts educational programs, trainings, seminars and webinars on various healthcare areas. Information about upcoming events is published on the official website in the 'Events' section. To participate, you need to register for the event you are interested in.

questions.question: How to access the center's publications and research?
questions.answer: Publications and research results of the center are available on the official website in the 'Publications' section. Some materials are openly accessible, to access full texts of some specialized research may require authorization or a request through the feedback form.

questions.question: Does the center cooperate with international organizations?
questions.answer: Yes, the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development actively cooperates with international organizations, including WHO, UNICEF, UNDP, as well as with leading medical and research institutes from other countries. We are open to new partnerships and international cooperation.

faq.notFoundTitle: Didn't find an answer to your question?
faq.notFoundText: You can ask your question through the feedback form or contact us directly.

partners.intro: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova actively cooperates with leading medical organizations of Kazakhstan and international partners. Our cooperation is aimed at exchanging experience, conducting joint scientific research, implementing educational programs and developing the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
partners.openText: We are open to new partnerships and ready to cooperate with organizations that share our values and strive to improve the quality of medical care and healthcare development.
cooperationItems: Joint scientific research in the field of medicine and healthcare
Development and implementation of innovative medical technologies
Exchange of experience and best practices in healthcare organization
Conducting educational programs and professional development of medical workers
Organization of joint scientific-practical conferences, seminars and forums
Development of methodological recommendations and standards in healthcare
partners.becomePartnerText: If you are interested in cooperation with the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova, please send a letter with a cooperation proposal to cooperation@nrchd.kz or contact us by phone +7 (7172) 70-95-30.

vacancies.noVacancies: Currently there are no active vacancies

aboutCentre.history:
By Resolution of the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated August 6, 2021 No. 532 "On certain issues of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan", the republican state enterprise on the right of economic management "Republican Center for Healthcare Development" (RCHD) of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan was renamed into the republican state enterprise on the right of economic management "National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova" of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
If we start with the history of formation, RCHD was created in 1994 in Almaty as a Scientific Center for Medical and Economic Problems of Healthcare. The successor of the Center - the Institute for Healthcare Development relocated to Astana, and in 2011, through merging with the Republican Information and Analytical Center, received the name of the Republican Center for Healthcare Development. Salidat Zekenovna Kairbekova stood at the origins of important directions in the Center's activities.
The first woman Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan, state and public figure of the RK, healthcare figure, Doctor of Medical Sciences S. Kairbekova dedicated her life to serving people, did tremendous work in the field of domestic healthcare.
In recognition of special merits in the field of domestic healthcare and in order to perpetuate the memory of Kairbekova S.Z., the RCHD staff together with the Council of Veterans of the Ministry of Health, as well as with representatives of the medical community, came forward with a petition to name the Center after Salidat Kairbekova.
During its work, the Center made a huge contribution to the development of the domestic healthcare system, participating in the development and methodologically supporting the implementation of state programs, road maps, sectoral projects and various regulatory legal acts.
The Center is also the working body of the Joint Commission on the Quality of Medical Services, the working body of the Formulary Commission, providing expert-analytical support for their work, the National Coordinator for Human Resources in Healthcare.

medicalEducation.title: Medical Education
medicalEducation.subtitle: Medical Education in the Republic of Kazakhstan
medicalEducation.intro: Training of medical personnel is one of the main priorities of the state.
medicalEducation.trainingIntro: To ensure the healthcare system with qualified medical personnel, the republic conducts training of medical personnel through:
medicalEducation.centers: 17 national centers, research institutes, scientific centers implementing residency programs
medicalEducation.levelsTitle: Doctor training is carried out at the following levels of education:
medicalEducation.residency: Residency – in 49 specialties from 2 to 4 years
medicalEducation.scientificMaster: Scientific and pedagogical master's degree (2 years)
medicalEducation.additionalText: In accordance with professional and educational needs of medical workers, 94 medical colleges provide training
medicalEducation.priorityDirections: Priority directions in developing the effectiveness of medical personnel training in the Republic of Kazakhstan in education and assistance to doctors are:
medicalEducation.priority1: Transition of distance learning forms for medical universities, medical and higher colleges (for the entire continuous cycle of bachelor's educational programs; specialized educational programs for bachelor's training; bachelor's scientific program; bachelor's clinical program; master's degree in training and practical preparation of masters) based on the introduction of experimental-innovative content, educational-methodological content and practical-methodological block;
medicalEducation.priority2: Continuous work of educational content groups of medical universities, medical colleges, research institutes, scientific centers and institutes in accordance with the best world practices from European countries.
medicalEducation.priority3: Development of bachelor's certification education methods, including certification educational programs in healthcare and new content technologies of certification education program methodology.

humanResources.title: Healthcare Human Resources
humanResources.subtitle: National Observatory of Healthcare Human Resources
humanResources.intro: Healthcare human resources are not abstract numbers, but real doctors, nurses, pharmacists and other healthcare workers who care for our health every day. To ensure this system works smoothly and effectively, the National Observatory of Healthcare Human Resources operates (hereinafter - the Observatory).
humanResources.mainGoalsText: Providing methodological support for research on healthcare human resources development policy through:
humanResources.goal1: development and implementation of effective planning and forecasting tools for medical personnel needs;
humanResources.goal2: systematic analysis and monitoring of medical personnel provision;
humanResources.goal3: development of methodological recommendations aimed at sustainable development and optimal distribution of healthcare human resources.
humanResources.mainGoalsEnd: The work conducted helps make informed decisions and ensures balanced development of the healthcare system.
humanResources.personnelFormationText: It is important not only to retain personnel but also to form them. Thus, one of the tools aimed at ensuring high-quality training of medical specialists is the placement of a state educational order for personnel training in residency. The Observatory, in turn, is the working body of the Commission for placing the state educational order for the training of medical personnel in residency.
humanResources.expertTeamActivity: Activities of the Expert Team in Medical Personnel Management
humanResources.expertTeamActivityText: In order to increase the sustainability of the healthcare human resources potential and ensure high-quality planning of medical resources, the team of experts takes a comprehensive approach to the analysis and forecasting of medical personnel, taking into account regional characteristics. The work is structured according to the following main directions:
humanResources.analyticalResearchIntro: Experts conduct a systematic assessment of the personnel situation in the regions, taking into account:
humanResources.analyticalEnd: The goal of the expert work is to form an objective picture of staffing, develop proposals for the distribution of the state educational order for the training of medical personnel in residency.
humanResources.deficitAnalysis: 2. Analysis of Deficit and Outflow of Medical Personnel
humanResources.deficitItem4: staff turnover indicators in the industry as a whole, in primary healthcare organizations;
humanResources.deficitItem5: studies both internal and external migration of medical personnel.
humanResources.deficitEnd: The results are used to make informed policy decisions and increase social support measures.
humanResources.planning: 3. Planning and Forecasting the Required Number of Medical Personnel
humanResources.planningIntro: Planning is conducted for short-, medium- and long-term perspectives. Special attention is paid to:
humanResources.planningItem1: accounting for the number of pre-retirement and retirement age workers;
humanResources.planningItem3: assessment of risks of mass exodus from the profession.
humanResources.planningEnd: The activities of the expert team are aimed at forming a balanced, sustainable and future-oriented personnel policy in healthcare.
humanResources.mainDirectionsTitle: Main Directions of the Observatory's Work
humanResources.mainDirection1: Monitoring staffing levels, conducting analytics on the state of human resources in the healthcare system.
humanResources.mainDirection2: Development of approaches and methods for analyzing the quantitative and qualitative composition of medical workers.
humanResources.mainDirection4: Development of proposals to improve the regulatory framework governing staffing issues.
humanResources.mainDirection5: Development of methodological guidelines and recommendations in the field of healthcare human resources.
humanResources.mainDirectionsEnd: The Observatory's activities are aimed at forming a balanced, sustainable and future-oriented personnel policy in healthcare.

electronicHealth.title: Digital Healthcare
electronicHealth.subtitle: Digital Transformation of Healthcare
electronicHealth.intro: The Department of Digital Healthcare Standards of the Center (hereinafter - the Department) was established in January 2023 and is a structural subdivision of the state institution with the right of economic management National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
electronicHealth.mainTasks: The main functions of the Department are:
electronicHealth.task1: evaluation of the effectiveness of digital products in healthcare;
electronicHealth.task2: analysis of current technologies and implementation of new electronic program equipment in healthcare;
electronicHealth.task3: development of effective models for the development of digital healthcare innovations;
electronicHealth.task4: integration of domestic experience into the development of public health services;
electronicHealth.task5: development, coordination and implementation of digital healthcare standards.
electronicHealth.departments: As of 15.01.2024, the Department consists of 2 divisions:
electronicHealth.dept1: Division of Standardization of Standards and Regulatory Framework of Digital Healthcare;
electronicHealth.dept2: Division of Methodological Support for Healthcare Digitalization.
electronicHealth.dept1Functions: Main functions of the Division of Standardization of Standards and Regulatory Framework of Digital Healthcare:
electronicHealth.dept1Task1: Development of proposals for standardization of digital healthcare standards;
electronicHealth.dept1Task2: Preparation of regulatory legal acts of the medical terminology registry, development of digital medical code projects;
electronicHealth.dept1Task3: Development of proposals for functionalization of reference books, classifiers and nomenclature of medical terminology;
electronicHealth.dept1Task4: Conducting proposals and analysis of planned and approved regulatory-methodological registries for the Ministry of Health: strategies for code approval of electronic classifiers;
electronicHealth.dept1Task5: Analysis of current technologies and implementation of new electronic program equipment in the regulatory framework of digital healthcare;
electronicHealth.dept1Task6: Conducting integrated research for the development of standards and regulatory framework of digital healthcare;
electronicHealth.dept1Task7: Work on standardization of digital healthcare and development of recommendations for the Ministry of Health: registries and digital healthcare;
electronicHealth.dept1Task8: Work on integration of national digital healthcare standards with international standards and international coordination service;
electronicHealth.dept1Task9: Participation and coordination of methodological composition for digital healthcare standardization.
electronicHealth.dept1Task10: Participation in the organization and coordination of standards, registries and terms for healthcare digitalization;
electronicHealth.dept1Task11: Participation in coordinating registry work and coordinating electronic classifiers with international statistical classifications of diseases and problems related to health used by the approval system of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
electronicHealth.workPlan2024Text: In 2024, the following standards in healthcare are planned for approval:
electronicHealth.standard1: Introduction of standard with national standard ST RK 3749-2021 - Electronic healthcare. Part 1. Electronic medical document;
electronicHealth.standard2: Introduction of standard with national standard ST RK 3750-2021 - Electronic healthcare. Part 2. Electronic medical record;
electronicHealth.standard3: Approval of draft national standard ST RK - Electronic healthcare. Part 3. Personal management of electronic medical codes;
electronicHealth.standard4: Adoption of national standard ST RK ISO 27932-2017 Information technologies. Standards for code exchange. Specifications of HL7 electronic registries. Release 2.
electronicHealth.mkb11Work: The Department is performing the following work for the ICD-11 registry service for the introduction by the Ministry of Health of the RK in 2024:
electronicHealth.mkb11Task1: Introduction of ICD-11 on the WHO platform in the state language;
electronicHealth.mkb11Task2: Technology, computerization and updating of ICD-11 classifiers with integration registry service intended for ICD-11 registries for the introduction by the Ministry of Health of RK for more than 15 ICD-11 classes;
electronicHealth.mkb11Task3: Integration of coding projects with correspondence to ICD-9 (with clinical modification) and with MC more than 5 ICD-11 classes;
electronicHealth.mkb11Task4: Approval of the draft model for translating terminology for ICD-11 for medical workers, each attached and working with electronic disease classifiers;

medicalAccreditation.title: Accreditation
medicalAccreditation.subtitle: Accreditation of Medical Organizations
medicalAccreditation.intro: Effectiveness, safety, quality and patient orientation are the fundamental principles of medical care provision in the Republic of Kazakhstan. The main criterion indicator of the healthcare system according to these criteria today is the quality of medical care. The key process for assessing quality and orientation of organizational services is the accreditation of medical organizations providing medical care and requirements for various social groups. Accreditation (an independent assessment process) of medical organizations is a voluntary process that determines its compliance with the forms of effectiveness and profile of medical organizations and treatment:
medicalAccreditation.benefitsItem2: Focus on accreditation standards and effective criteria.
medicalAccreditation.benefitsItem3: Improving quality assessment for medical standards.
medicalAccreditation.step1Description: Providing the following necessary information for accreditation basics by phone number 8 (7172) 648-951 (ext. 1000,1143,1127, 1046, 1064, 1014)
medicalAccreditation.step2Description: Consultation on the document package preparation process.
medicalAccreditation.step3Description: Payment for limited approved and accredited services for the organization period.
medicalAccreditation.step4Title: Formalization of accreditation for service results
medicalAccreditation.step4Description: Review of representative document package approved for accreditation. Meeting is held and decision on accreditation is issued.
medicalAccreditation.step5Description: Document package preparation. Documents are formed based on compliance with medical accreditation standards in medical organizations.
medicalAccreditation.step6Description: Accreditation certificate or status confirmation is issued. The certificate is valid for 3 years.

healthRate.title: Health Technology Assessment
healthRate.subtitle: HTA - Health Technology Assessment
healthRate.intro2: The Republican Center for Healthcare Development of the Ministry of Health of the RK announces that the acceptance of applications for health technology assessment has begun since 2021 on priority topics for the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan as of January 11, 2021.
healthRate.intro3: Applications are approved in accordance with Appendix 3 to the Order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated June 30, 2020 No. ҚR DSM-215/2020 «On approval of the Rules for conducting health technology assessment and their application».
healthRate.intro4: Applications with a cover letter should be sent to: Nur-Sultan, M.Dulati st. 13, business center «Emerald», Republican Center for Healthcare Development, marked «For the department of health technology assessment» and to the email office@rcrz.kz.
healthRate.additionalInfo1: The Republican Center for Healthcare Development began accepting applications for medical technology assessment in 2020. Applications should be sent to the applicant not later than May 15, 2020.
healthRate.additionalInfo2: The Republican Center for Healthcare Development of the Ministry of Health of the RK (hereinafter - RCHD) announces that in connection with the entry into force of the Decree of the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated March 15, 2020 «On the introduction of a state of emergency in the Republic of Kazakhstan» and the decision of the State Commission to ensure the emergency regime of the RK President «On the introduction of quarantine regime in Nur-Sultan city and region» the deadline for accepting applications for health technology assessment since 2020 on priority topics for the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan is extended to May 15, 2020.
healthRate.additionalInfo3: Furthermore, we want to notify that special priority will be given to technologies for diagnostics and treatment of coronavirus infection. Applications are approved in accordance with Appendix 2 to the Order of the Acting Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan No. ҚR DSM-85 dated May 22, 2019 «On approval of the Rules for conducting health technology assessment».
healthRate.additionalInfo4: Applications with a cover letter should be sent to: Republic of Kazakhstan, Nur-Sultan, M.Dulati st. 13, business center «Emerald», Republican Center for Healthcare Development, marked «For the department of health technology assessment» and to the email office@rcrz.kz.
healthRate.bulletItem1: MOH-order: functions that need to be performed within the framework of medical health technology assessment
healthRate.bulletItem3: Prioritization list for conducting HTA in 2023
healthRate.bulletItem4: Results of prioritization for medical technology assessment in 2020
healthRate.bulletItem5: Technologies that did not receive prioritization for health technology assessment (HTA) in 2020
healthRate.htaDescription: Health Technology Assessment (HTA) is a multidisciplinary research approach that includes collection and synthesis of information about healthcare technology. Information can cover objectives from effects, scientific evidence of effectiveness and safety, effectiveness needs and price status, organizational and social aspects, as well as legal and regulatory issues. Information collection and presentation is carried out on a systematic, objective and transparent basis.
healthRate.htaLimitations: HTA in the Republic of Kazakhstan healthcare is limited. Financial and other technology resources may require reduction or cessation of funding for other services. In these conditions, it is important that each choice is based on price and quality evidence, presented data in the form of main HTA objectives. The goal is to develop national guiding principles for conducting HTA to ensure timely, fair, research-based and appropriate HTA implementation, decisions made in HTA healthcare and key stakeholders.
healthRate.regulatoryItem1: Rules for conducting HTA, approved by the Order of the General Director of RCHD dated 30.10.2020
healthRate.regulatoryItem2: Lists of expert groups for medical technology assessment
healthRate.partnership: Strategic partnership with leading international bodies
healthRate.partnershipInfo: to conduct HTA we continued to optimize our work

clinicalProtocols.title: Clinical Protocols
clinicalProtocols.subtitle: National Clinical Protocols and Guidelines
clinicalProtocols.intro1: – scientifically proven recommendations for prevention, diagnosis, treatment, medical rehabilitation and palliative medical care for a specific disease or patient conditions in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
clinicalProtocols.intro2: Medical care provided by healthcare entities is regulated by standards, rules and clinical protocols in accordance with healthcare legislation in Kazakhstan.
clinicalProtocols.typesInfo: There are four types of clinical protocols covering diagnosis and treatment, medical interventions, medical rehabilitation and palliative care.
clinicalProtocols.developmentInfo: Clinical protocols are developed by scientific medical centers with the participation of higher medical educational institutions and non-governmental organizations. They include codes from the international classification of diseases.
clinicalProtocols.regulationInfo: The National Scientific Center regulates the expert evaluation of clinical protocols taking into account requirements for their development, rational pharmacotherapy and evidence-based medicine.
clinicalProtocols.reviewInfo: Clinical protocols are reviewed every 5 years or when new methods with a higher level of evidence appear.
clinicalProtocols.regulatoryDoc1: On approval of the methodology for implementation and evaluation of the effectiveness of clinical protocols implementation in practical healthcare. Order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated November 12, 2020 No. ҚR DSM - 189/2020.
clinicalProtocols.regulatoryDoc2: Algorithm for implementation and monitoring of clinical protocols implementation in practical healthcare.
clinicalProtocols.regulatoryDoc3: Roadmap for monitoring the implementation of clinical protocols in practical healthcare (in medical organizations).

medicalRating.title: Medical Organizations Rating
medicalRating.subtitle: Evaluation and Rating of Medical Organizations
medicalRating.intro: Rating evaluation of medical organizations allows identifying clinics with the best performance results, and also provides tools for clinic management to focus on improving the quality of medical care provided. The goal of rating evaluation is to build trust between society and the healthcare system.
medicalRating.bestOrganizationsTitle: Best of the Best in Healthcare of the Republic of Kazakhstan
medicalRating.methodologicalFolder: Medical Organizations Rating/Set - Methodological Guidelines for Rating Medical Organizations

medicalScience.title: Medical Science
medicalScience.subtitle: Scientific Research and Innovations
medicalScience.intro1: Development of scientific research – support and coordination of fundamental and applied research aimed at solving urgent healthcare problems.
medicalScience.intro2: Analysis and evaluation of scientific activities – monitoring the effectiveness of research, scientific-technical and innovative projects.
medicalScience.intro3: Development and implementation of innovations – promoting technology transfer and integration of advanced scientific achievements into clinical practice.
medicalScience.intro4: Formation of scientific policy – development of strategies and recommendations for improving medical science and education.
medicalScience.intro5: International cooperation – interaction with leading world scientific centers and participation in international projects.
medicalScience.ratingTitle: Results of rating evaluation of scientific organizations and medical universities by indicators of scientific and innovative activities

research.title: List of Approved Scientific and Medical Developments
research.description: Information about scientific and medical developments

bioethics.title: Central Commission on Bioethics
bioethics.subtitle: Bioethics and Biobanks
bioethics.mainTitle: CENTRAL COMMISSION ON BIOETHICS UNDER THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH OF THE REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN
bioethics.intro1: The Central Commission on Bioethics of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan is an independent expert body conducting bioethical examination of documents related to biomedical research at the stage of their planning, during implementation and after completion in order to ensure the safety and protection of the rights of biomedical research participants.
bioethics.intro2: The Central Commission on Bioethics determines the strategy and tactics of bioethical development of the republic, development of sound bioethical policy, conducting scientific research in the field of healthcare and human sciences, coordination of activities of local bioethics commissions, their certification, participation in the development of documents on bioethics issues.
bioethics.intro3: The Central Commission on Bioethics was established in 2008 under the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan, and in 2017 received international recognition (full recognition) from the Forum of Ethics Committees of Southeast Asian countries under the auspices of WHO FERCAP/SIDCER and permanent membership in the organization.
bioethics.chairman: Chairman of the Central Commission on Bioethics
bioethics.chairmanInfo: Yergaliyev Kuanysh Asylkhanovich, Doctor of Public Health, Assistant Professor of Practice School of Medicine AEO «Nazarbayev University», Chairman of the Board of the Association of Health Managers of Kazakhstan.
bioethics.orderPrefix: By Order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan No. 961 dated December 31, 2024 «On amending the order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 20, 2020 No. 854/1 «On approval of the composition of the Central Commission on Bioethics»» a new composition of the Central Commission on Bioethics was approved (
bioethics.compositionLink: Composition of the Central Commission on Bioethics
bioethics.workingBodyInfo: of the Central Commission on Bioethics is defined as «National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova» of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
bioethics.regulationLink: Regulation on the Central Commission on Bioethics
bioethics.regulationInfo: (Order of the Minister of Health of the RK dated October 23, 2020 No. ҚR DSM-151/2020 «On approval of the Regulation on the Central Commission on Bioethics»)
bioethics.meetingScheduleTitle: Schedule of meetings of the Central Commission on Bioethics for 2025
bioethics.addressInfo: 010000, Republic of Kazakhstan, Astana, Mangilik El st., 20

sop.description: Standard operating procedures for bioethical examination

certification.description: Certification of local bioethics commissions of medical organizations

biobanks.description: Supervision of biobanks and biocollections activities

drugPolicy.title: Drug Policy
drugPolicy.subtitle: Pharmaceutical Supply Policy
drugPolicy.intro1: Drug policy is a crucial component of the healthcare system aimed at providing the population with quality, safe and effective medicines. The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova plays a key role in the formation and implementation of drug policy in the Republic of Kazakhstan.
drugPolicy.intro2: The main areas of work in the field of drug policy are:
drugPolicy.direction1: Formation and updating of lists of medicines within the guaranteed volume of free medical care (GVFMC) and mandatory social health insurance (MSHI)
drugPolicy.direction2: Development and improvement of rules for forming drug lists
drugPolicy.direction3: Conducting expertise of medicines and medical devices
drugPolicy.direction4: Monitoring the effectiveness and safety of medicines
drugPolicy.direction5: Development of methodological recommendations for rational use of medicines
drugPolicy.faqSubtitle: Answers to the most common questions on drug policy
drugPolicy.faq1Question: Reimbursement lists within GVFMC and MSHI
drugPolicy.faq1Link2: List of orphan diseases and medicines
drugPolicy.faq1Link5: Rules for forming the SD list
drugPolicy.faq1Link7: Rules for forming the OPS list (repealed)
drugPolicy.faq1Link8: Rules for forming the list of orphan diseases and medicines
drugPolicy.faq3Link: Code of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated July 7, 2020 No. 360-VI ZRK «ON THE HEALTH OF THE PEOPLE AND THE HEALTHCARE SYSTEM»
drugPolicy.faq3Answer: This Code regulates public relations in the field of healthcare with the aim of implementing the constitutional right of citizens to health protection.

regulations.title: Regulations
regulations.description: Regulatory legal acts in the field of drug policy

commission.title: Commission
commission.description: Information about the drug policy commission

primaryHealthcare.title: Primary Healthcare
primaryHealthcare.subtitle: Development of PHC System
primaryHealthcare.intro: Primary Healthcare (PHC) is a key component of the healthcare system, providing accessible and quality medical services to the population at the level of first contact with the healthcare system. PHC includes basic medical services that are available to all citizens, regardless of socio-economic status and geographical location.
primaryHealthcare.principle1: Accessibility and universal coverage of the population with medical services
primaryHealthcare.principle4: Continuity and seamlessness of medical care provision
primaryHealthcare.direction1: Strengthening human resources capacity and raising the status of healthcare workers
primaryHealthcare.direction2: Development of PHC infrastructure in accordance with modern requirements
primaryHealthcare.direction3: Implementation of digital technologies and information systems
primaryHealthcare.direction5: Expansion of preventive programs and screening studies

healthAccounts.title: National Health Accounts
healthAccounts.subtitle: Healthcare Expenditure Accounting System
healthAccounts.intro: National Health Accounts is statistical data that enables regular, comprehensive and consistent monitoring of financial flows in the country's healthcare system. This is an important tool for objective and rational allocation of resources for both decision-making and personal use by citizens.

medicalStatistics.title: Medical Statistics
medicalStatistics.subtitle: Healthcare Statistical Data
medicalStatistics.intro: The Department of Medical and Statistical Analysis collects, processes and systematically analyzes statistical data in the healthcare sector of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Its tasks include studying the dynamics of population health indicators, the effectiveness of medical organizations, as well as forecasting the resource needs of the healthcare system.
medicalStatistics.additionalInfo1: As part of its activities, the Department conducts epidemiological and demographic studies, analyzes key indicators in priority areas of healthcare, creates statistical reviews and provides methodological support for the calculation and interpretation of indicators.
medicalStatistics.additionalInfo2: At the same time, it organizes training events aimed at improving the quality of statistical accounting and analytics in medical organizations.
medicalStatistics.contact1Position: Head of Healthcare Statistical Accounting and Reporting Department
medicalStatistics.contact2Position: Head of Healthcare Statistical Monitoring Department

techCompetence.title: Technological Competence Center
techCompetence.subtitle: Technological Innovations and Competencies
techCompetence.intro1: The Industry Technological Competence Center (ITCC) in healthcare was established based on Order No. 667 of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated October 18, 2021, on the basis of the Salidat Kairbekova National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development.
techCompetence.intro2: ITCC is a key element in the development and implementation of innovative technologies in the healthcare system.
techCompetence.task1: Foresight forecasting in the field of science and technology, new professions and competencies for the healthcare system
techCompetence.task2: Participation in the formation of technological policies (strategies)
techCompetence.task3: Assistance to healthcare organizations in implementing world-class technologies and developments by Kazakh researchers, in accordance with the organization's specifics
techCompetence.direction1Description: Analysis of global trends and forecasting of technology development in healthcare
techCompetence.direction2Description: Formation and development of technological competencies among healthcare professionals
techCompetence.direction3Description: Assistance to healthcare organizations in implementing modern technologies and innovative developments
techCompetence.direction4Description: Coordination of interaction between healthcare organizations, research centers and research institutes
techCompetence.conclusion: ITCC is focused on promoting technological development and strengthening competencies, contributing to progress and innovation in the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
techCompetence.regulatoryDocsFolder: Medical Science\Folder - Industry Technological Competence Center\Set-NPA
techCompetence.formDescription:
We consider proposals from startups, doctors and research teams and provide support on technology assessment, legal development, commercialization paths and integration into the healthcare system.
Our task is to support promising solutions at early stages of development and facilitate their promotion within the framework of current regulatory and strategic documents of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
techCompetence.formSuccessMessage: Thank you for your application! We will contact you shortly.

centerPrevention.title: Center for Prevention and Health Promotion
centerPrevention.subtitle: Health Promotion and Prevention
centerPrevention.intro: The NNCHD Center for Prevention and Health Promotion develops and implements programs aimed at early disease detection and the formation of healthy habits among the population.
centerPrevention.column2Item3: Culture of healthy and rational nutrition
centerPrevention.column2Item4: Measures to reduce tobacco and alcohol use
centerPrevention.youthCentersDescription: Interactive map of youth health centers throughout the Republic of Kazakhstan

medicalTourism.title: Medical Tourism
medicalTourism.subtitle: Development of Medical Tourism in Kazakhstan
medicalTourism.intro: Medical tourism is an important direction in the development of Kazakhstan's healthcare system. The Salidat Kairbekova National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development coordinates a set of activities to promote Kazakhstan as an attractive destination for medical tourism and to improve the quality of medical services for foreign patients.
medicalTourism.popularDirectionsDescription: Kazakhstan offers a wide range of high-quality medical services at affordable prices
medicalTourism.cardiologyDescription: Diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular diseases using modern technologies
medicalTourism.orthopedicsDescription: Joint replacement, sports traumatology and rehabilitation
medicalTourism.reproductiveMedicineDescription: IVF and other infertility treatment methods with high success rates

qualityCommission.title: Joint Commission on Quality of Medical Services
qualityCommission.subtitle: Quality Assessment of Medical Services
qualityCommission.mainTitle: Joint Commission on Quality of Medical Services
qualityCommission.intro1: The Joint Commission on Quality of Medical Services (JCC) is an advisory and consultative body under the authorized body in the field of healthcare of the Republic of Kazakhstan. The Commission deals with the assessment and monitoring of the quality of medical services, reviews the results of health technology assessment and makes decisions on their implementation in the healthcare system.
qualityCommission.intro2: The powers of the Joint Commission include the review and approval of clinical protocols, standards for the provision of medical care, as well as making decisions on the possibility of including new technologies and medicines in the financing system within the framework of GOBMP and OSMS.
qualityCommission.additionalInfo1: The Commission holds regular meetings to consider issues of quality of medical care, analyzes the results of health technology assessment and develops recommendations for improving the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
qualityCommission.functionsTitle: Main Functions of the Joint Commission:
qualityCommission.function1: Review and approval of clinical protocols for diagnosis and treatment
qualityCommission.function2: Assessment of the quality of medical services and standards of medical care
qualityCommission.function3: Making decisions on the inclusion of new technologies in the financing system
qualityCommission.function4: Monitoring the effectiveness of implemented medical technologies
qualityCommission.function5: Development of recommendations for improving the quality of medical care
qualityCommission.function6: Coordination of activities to ensure the quality of medical services
qualityCommission.compositionInfo: The Joint Commission consists of leading healthcare specialists, representatives of medical organizations, scientific institutions and public organizations. The Commission operates on the principles of collegiality, independence and objectivity.
qualityCommission.resultsInfo: The Commission's activities are aimed at improving the quality of medical care, ensuring the availability of modern medical technologies for the population and the effective use of the resources of the healthcare system of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

standards.title: Standards
standards.displayTitle: Technical Committee for Standardization No. 83 Digital Healthcare

npa.title: Regulations
npa.intro1: The Central Commission on Bioethics under the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan carries out its activities in accordance with the national legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan and international standards in the field of bioethics.
npa.intro2: This section presents the main regulatory legal acts governing activities in the field of bioethics, including the national legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan and international documents recognized by the world community.
npa.nationalIntro: Main regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Kazakhstan governing activities in the field of bioethics, conducting biomedical research and ensuring the safety of research participants.
npa.internationalIntro: International standards and guiding principles in the field of bioethics, recognized by the world community and applied in the activities of the Central Commission on Bioethics.
npa.infoUpdate: Regulatory legal acts may be updated in accordance with changes in legislation. It is recommended to regularly check the relevance of documents from official sources.
npa.infoApplication: All biomedical research in the Republic of Kazakhstan must be conducted in accordance with current regulatory legal acts and international standards.
npa.infoConsultations: For questions on the application of regulatory legal acts in the field of bioethics, you can contact the Central Commission on Bioethics.

localCommissions.title: Local Commissions
localCommissions.intro: List of certified local bioethics commissions authorized to conduct ethical expertise of biomedical research in the Republic of Kazakhstan.

documents.title: Bioethics Documents
documents.orderTitle: Procedure for Submitting an Application for Bioethical Expertise
documents.interventionalIntro: To obtain approval for a clinical trial, the applicant submits the following documents in hard copy and electronic format to the CCB Secretariat:
documents.nonInterventionalIntro: To conduct a non-interventional clinical trial, the applicant submits the following documents in hard copy and electronic format to the Commission Secretariat:

composition.title: Composition
composition.orderInfo: By order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan No. 961 dated December 31, 2024 'On amending the order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 20, 2020 No. 854/1 'On approval of the composition of the Central Commission on Bioethics'' the new composition of the Central Commission on Bioethics was approved.
composition.chairmanInfo: Ergaliev Kuanysh Asylkhanovich - Doctor of Public Health, Assistant Professor of Practice, School of Medicine, Nazarbayev University, Chairman of the Board of the Association of Healthcare Managers of Kazakhstan
composition.workingBodyName: 'National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova' of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan
composition.addressValue: Astana, Mangilik El street 20, block C, 5th floor, office 507

certification.title: Certification
certification.intro: Local bioethics commissions have the right to issue opinions on conducting biomedical research subject to having a certificate of compliance with the standards of bioethics commissions, issued by the Central Commission on Bioethics of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan (paragraph 8, Article 228 of the RK Code 'On People's Health and Healthcare System').
certification.legalText: Activities on certification of local bioethics commissions are carried out in accordance with the order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 9, 2020 No. QR DSM-243/2020 'On approval of the rules for issuing and validity period of the certificate of compliance with the requirements of bioethics commissions'.
certification.procedureTitle: Procedure for Certification of Local Bioethics Commissions (LBC)

biobanks.title: Biobanks
biobanks.intro: In accordance with the order of the Acting Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 24, 2020 No. QR DSM-328/2020 'On approval of the rules for the creation and operation of biobanks', biobanks are created on the basis of a positive opinion of the Central Commission on Bioethics.
biobanks.procedureTitle: Procedure for Obtaining an Opinion from the Central Commission on Bioethics
biobanks.packagesTitle: Document Package for Obtaining an Opinion from the Central Commission on Bioethics:

gosoTup.intro: This section presents the State Compulsory Education Standards (GOSO) and Typical Curricula (TUP) for medical education.

documents.h1: Information System Catalog of Continuing Education Programs in Healthcare
documents.expertiseIntro: Conducting expertise of an educational program (EP) for inclusion of continuing education EP in the Catalog is carried out on the basis of a service agreement concluded with the applicant.
documents.tableRow1Service: Research work on conducting expertise of continuing education programs in terms of certification courses
documents.tableRow1Price: Free (according to the program approval protocol at UMO RUMS)
documents.tableRow2Service: Research work on conducting expertise of continuing education programs in terms of professional development courses
documents.conclusionText: To include a continuing education program in healthcare in the IS "Catalog of continuing education programs" it is necessary to pass an examination at the NNCHD.

monitoring.reportsFolder: Clinical Protocols\Folder - Clinical Protocols Monitoring\Folder - Reports

commission.title: Formulary Commission
commission.h1: Formulary Commission of the MH RK
commission.aboutText: The Formulary Commission is a permanent advisory and consultative body under the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan and is guided in its activities by the Constitution of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Laws of the Republic of Kazakhstan and other regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Kazakhstan, as well as the Regulation on the FC MH RK.
commission.currentComposition1: By order of the Minister of Health of the RK dated July 24, 2024 No. 478, a new composition of the FC MH RK was approved. The composition includes 11 people, representatives of the authorized body and expert-level clinical pharmacologists.
commission.currentComposition2: Nurlybaev Yerzhan Shakirovich was appointed Chairman of the FC MH RK - Vice Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Adilkhan Zhandos Koyshibaevich was elected Deputy - Director of the Department of Drug Policy of the MH RK.
commission.history1: Previously, by order of the Minister of Health of the RK dated May 5, 2021 No. 263, the composition of the FC MH RK of 32 people was approved, which consisted of representatives of the authorized body, pharmaceutical associations, heads and leading specialists of medical centers, profile experts in the field of drug circulation, etc.
commission.history2: Burkitbayev Zhandos Konysovich was appointed Chairman of the FC MH RK - Vice Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Over the years of work (from 2022 to 2023), the composition of the FC MH RK changed 3 times.
commission.changesIntro: Changes were made to the main composition of the FC MH RK, approved by the order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated May 05, 2021 No. 263, by orders of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan:
commission.legalBasis1: By order of the Acting Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated April 15, 2021 No. 215 'On approval of the regulation on the Formulary Commission of the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan' (hereinafter - Order No. 215) RSE on REM 'National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova' MH RK (hereinafter - RSE 'NSCHD') was designated as the Working Body of the FC MH RK.
commission.legalBasis2: By order of the Minister of Health dated May 14, 2024 No. 309, changes and additions were made to Order No. 215, regarding the number of members of the FC MH RK, functions of the Working Body and Secretary, namely:
commission.noteText: We note that the Working Body posts meeting protocols on the KNF internet resource no later than three calendar days from the date of signing.
commission.resultsIntro: From 2021 to 2024, a total of 107 meetings were held:
commission.reviewedIntro: At the meetings, the following projects were reviewed:
commission.ordersTitle: Orders on the Composition of the Formulary Commission of the MH RK
commission.ordersFolder: Drug Policy\Formulary Commission of the MH RK\Orders on the Composition of the Formulary Commission of the MH RK

prevention.title: Prevention
prevention.intro: Prevention and screening are key components of primary health care aimed at preventing diseases and early detection of pathologies before the onset of pronounced symptoms.
prevention.type1: Primary prevention — a set of measures aimed at preventing the development of diseases (vaccination, formation of a healthy lifestyle, hygienic education)
prevention.type2: Secondary prevention — detection of diseases at early stages using screening programs
prevention.type3: Tertiary prevention — prevention of exacerbations of chronic diseases, disability and death
prevention.screening1: Oncological diseases (breast cancer, colorectal cancer, cervical cancer, prostate cancer)
prevention.screening2: Cardiovascular diseases (blood pressure measurement, cholesterol level determination)
prevention.screening5: Glaucoma and cataract (intraocular pressure measurement, visual acuity testing)
prevention.component4: Formation of motivation for a healthy lifestyle among the population
prevention.component6: Health schools for patients with chronic diseases
prevention.benefit1: Reduction of morbidity and mortality from preventable causes
prevention.benefit2: Early detection of diseases when treatment is most effective
prevention.benefit3: Cost-effectiveness (prevention is cheaper than treatment of advanced forms of diseases)
prevention.benefit4: Improvement of quality of life of the population
prevention.benefit5: Reduction of burden on the healthcare system

outpatient.title: Outpatient Care
outpatient.intro: Outpatient care is the most important part of the primary health care system, aimed at providing medical care to patients without round-the-clock medical supervision in a polyclinic, outpatient clinic or directly at home.
outpatient.componentsTitle: Main Components of Outpatient Care Include:
outpatient.component1: Primary medical care provided by general practitioners, therapists and pediatricians
outpatient.component2: Specialized outpatient care provided by narrow specialists
outpatient.component7: Patronage and monitoring of patients from risk groups
outpatient.task1: Timely detection and treatment of diseases at early stages
outpatient.task2: Prevention of hospitalizations through provision of quality treatment at the outpatient stage
outpatient.task3: Disease prevention and formation of a healthy lifestyle
outpatient.task4: Ensuring continuity and succession of medical care
outpatient.task5: Dispensary observation of patients with chronic diseases
outpatient.perspectivesTitle: Prospects for Development of Outpatient Care:
outpatient.perspective1: Implementation of electronic systems for appointment scheduling and medical record keeping
outpatient.perspective2: Development of outpatient surgery and hospital-replacing technologies
outpatient.perspective3: Expansion of the range of medical services provided in outpatient settings
outpatient.perspective4: Implementation of telemedicine technologies for consultations and patient monitoring
outpatient.perspective5: Strengthening preventive focus through expansion of screening programs

research.title: Research
research.h1: List of Approved Scientific and Medical Developments
research.folder: Medical Science/List of Approved Scientific and Medical Developments

clinical.title: Clinical Trials
clinical.intro: CRDC was created in 2022 by order of the Minister of Health of the RK to ensure the development and coordination of clinical trials
clinical.nisTitle: National Information System on Biomedical Research
clinical.nisIntro1: The National Information System on Biomedical Research is an information resource consolidating data on biomedical research.
clinical.nisIntro2: Designed to automate business processes of clinical trials – from the stage of submitting an application for registration to reporting.
clinical.registry1Text: Allows to optimize the clinical trial management process. The registry operates on the principle of a 'single window', allowing to consolidate all participants/stakeholders in the clinical trial management process.
clinical.registry2Text: Includes data on domestic researchers conducting clinical trials on the territory of the RK. This registry is intended to search for potential researchers and form an up-to-date database of Kazakhstan researchers.
clinical.registry3Text: Contains data on healthcare organizations of the RK on the basis of which clinical trials are conducted. The registry allows to assess the industry's readiness for research implementation (infrastructure) and study their potential, keep records of clinical sites.
clinical.registry4Text: Designed to form a pool of potential volunteers to participate in clinical trials. A citizen of the RK who has expressed a desire to participate in a study can submit a request to include their candidacy in this registry, with subsequent involvement.
clinical.registry5Text: A registry with restricted access containing information on potential research subjects and patients participating in current or completed projects. This registry is intended to assess the readiness of a clinical site in particular, and the country as a whole in conducting clinical research.
clinical.materialsTitle: Analytical reports, informational, methodological materials and publications
clinical.publicationsTitle: Scientific Publications of the Clinical Research Development Center
clinical.potentialIntro1: To unify knowledge and increase the potential of researchers involved in clinical trials, the Clinical Research Development Center has created an online educational resource.
clinical.potentialIntro2: The resource is a virtual learning environment for training healthcare professionals in clinical research.
clinical.potentialIntro3: The online educational resource is a tool for increasing the potential of experienced researchers, as well as intended to provide new knowledge and skills to young specialists (including those studying in master's and doctoral programs). The distance learning approach will allow course participants to study at a convenient time regardless of location, and receive a certificate of successful completion of the course materials after passing the final test.
clinical.potentialIntro4: The educational materials of the resource are developed based on international standards and national legislation of the RK. Presentation materials and library resources are intended to be a support for the researcher in the process of their activities, as they cover a wide range of issues on the topic being studied.
clinical.basicCourseText: Course – GCP Fundamentals. Introduction to the organization and conduct of clinical trials (basic course).
clinical.advancedCourseText: Course – International GCP standards, current issues of organization and conduct of clinical trials (advanced course).

tech.title: Technologies
tech.intro: The Sectoral Center for Technological Competencies (SCTC) in healthcare was created on the basis of the order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan No. 667 dated 18.10.2021 on the basis of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova, SCTC is a key element in the development and implementation of innovative technologies in the healthcare system.
tech.task1: Foresight forecasting in the field of science and technology, new professions and competencies for the healthcare system;
tech.task2: participation in the formation of technological policies (strategies);
tech.task3: assistance to healthcare organizations in implementing world-class technologies and developments of Kazakhstan researchers, in accordance with the specifics of the organization.
tech.conclusion: SCTC is focused on promoting technological development and strengthening competencies, contributing to progress and innovation.
tech.npaFolder: Medical Science\Sectoral Center for Technological Competencies\NPA

council.title: Council
council.intro: RSE on REM 'National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova' of the Ministry of Health of the RK has the status of an organization engaged in scientific activities. In this regard, the organization has a Scientific Council, headed by the head and is a permanent advisory body created for the purpose of scientific and methodological support of the NSCHD activities.
council.tasksTitle: The main tasks of the Council are:
council.contactInfo: You can get all the necessary information on scientific and methodological activities by the following phones: 8 (7172) 700950 ext. (1057)

activeStandards.title: Active Standards
activeStandards.intro: This section presents the current regulatory documents governing the standards and criteria for accreditation of medical organizations in the Republic of Kazakhstan. Here you will find the approved requirements that a medical organization must meet to obtain accreditation.

standardsArchive.title: Standards Archive
standardsArchive.intro: This section contains previously applicable standards and criteria for accreditation of medical organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan that are no longer in use but retain historical and scientific value. The documents in this section may be useful for studying the evolution of the accreditation system and comparative analysis.

guides.title: Guides
guides.intro: This section presents guides and methodological materials that will help you prepare for the accreditation process of medical organizations. Here you will find documents containing requirements, recommendations and instructions for accreditation in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

experts.title: Experts
experts.intro: A total of 114 specialists who have undergone appropriate training and certification are registered in the NSCHD expert registry.

commission.title: Commission
commission.intro1: The Accreditation Commission is a collegial body for assessing the compliance of healthcare organizations with accreditation standards. The Accreditation Commission carries out its activities on the basis of the Order of the Minister of Health of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 21, 2020 No. ҚР ДСМ-305/2020 'On approval of the rules for accreditation in the field of healthcare'.
commission.intro2: The composition of the accreditation commission is approved by the accrediting body. The accreditation commission includes representatives of government bodies and organizations, non-governmental public associations and associations, specialists in the field of science and education who have undergone training on accreditation in the field of healthcare.
commission.intro3: The activities of the accreditation commission of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development are aimed at ensuring the quality of medical services through an objective assessment of medical organizations. The commission operates on the principles of independence, impartiality and professionalism, using modern standards and methodologies recognized at the international level.
commission.intro4: The commission's tasks include examining the compliance of medical organizations with accreditation standards, forming recommendations for improving the quality of medical services, as well as developing a culture of patient safety in healthcare organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
commission.compositionTitle: Composition of the NSCHD Accreditation Commission

trainingMaterials.title: Training Materials
trainingMaterials.intro: Successful accreditation of a medical organization requires thorough preparation of all specialists. In this section you will find educational and methodological materials, presentations, webinar recordings and other resources that will help your organization effectively prepare for the external comprehensive assessment procedure.

regional.title: Regional Rating
regional.rating2018Title: Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2018
regional.rating2018Folder: Medical Organizations Rating/Ratings Archive/Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2018
regional.rating2017Title: Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2017
regional.rating2017Folder: Medical Organizations Rating/Ratings Archive/Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2017
regional.rating2016Title: Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2016
regional.rating2016Folder: Medical Organizations Rating/Ratings Archive/Rating of Medical Organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2016

quality.title: Quality
quality.mainTitle: Medical Organizations Rating Results by Accessibility and Quality of Medical Care Criteria
quality.intro: We present the results of comprehensive rating of medical organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan by criteria of accessibility and quality of medical care provided.

otzReports.title: HTA Reports
otzReports.intro: This section presents health technology assessment (HTA) reports prepared by the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova. The reports contain analysis of clinical effectiveness, safety and economic feasibility of health technologies for making decisions on their implementation in the healthcare system.
otzReports.noApplicationsFiltered: No applications found with the specified filters
otzReports.checkDatabase: Is there data in the database

research.title: Research
research.intro1: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova conducts strategic research aimed at improving the healthcare system of Kazakhstan and achieving key population health indicators.
research.intro2: The Center's strategic research and initiatives are based on analysis of the current situation in healthcare, study of international experience and best practices, as well as forecasting future trends and challenges in healthcare.
research.direction1Text: comprehensive assessment of healthcare system effectiveness, identifying strengths and weaknesses, developing recommendations for improvement.
research.direction2Text: studying disease prevalence, risk factors and determinants of population health.
research.direction3Text: analysis of effectiveness, safety and economic feasibility of medical technologies, medicines and treatment methods.
research.direction4Text: development of optimal models for medical care delivery, including primary healthcare, specialized and high-tech care.
research.direction5Text: analysis of medical personnel needs, development of recommendations for training and distribution of medical workers.

partnership.title: Partnership
partnership.intro1: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova actively develops partnerships with leading international healthcare organizations, scientific and educational institutions from various countries.
partnership.intro2: Partnership with international organizations allows the Center to exchange experience, implement world best practices in Kazakhstan's healthcare system, participate in global initiatives to improve population health.
partnership.partner1Text: cooperation in healthcare policy development, experience and expertise exchange, participation in global programs to combat infectious and non-communicable diseases.
partnership.partner2Text: joint projects on maternal and child health, vaccination and nutrition, pediatric service development.
partnership.partner3Text: projects on healthcare system modernization and improving medical services efficiency, infrastructure project financing.
partnership.partner4Text: cooperation on public health issues, disease prevention, health system strengthening.
partnership.partner5Text: projects on sustainable healthcare development, access to medical services, combating HIV/AIDS and tuberculosis.

initiatives.title: Initiatives
initiatives.intro: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova implements a number of strategic initiatives aimed at improving Kazakhstan's healthcare system and achieving key population health indicators.

expert.title: Expert Council
expert.intro: The Expert Council of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova is a collegial body uniting leading specialists in various fields of medicine and healthcare. The Council provides scientific-methodological and expert support for the Center's activities, promotes innovative approaches and best practices in the healthcare system.

coalition.title: Coalition
coalition.intro: The Healthcare Development Coalition is an association of stakeholders created under the auspices of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova. The Coalition unites representatives of public and private healthcare sectors, research and educational institutions, professional communities, patient organizations and other stakeholders to jointly address current healthcare challenges.

astanaDeclaration.title: Astana Declaration
astanaDeclaration.description: Astana Declaration on Primary Health Care
astanaDeclaration.h1: Astana Declaration on Primary Health Care
astanaDeclaration.mainTitle: Astana Declaration on Primary Health Care
astanaDeclaration.intro1: The Astana Declaration was adopted at the Global Conference on Primary Health Care, which took place on October 25-26, 2018 in Astana (now Nur-Sultan), Kazakhstan. The conference was organized by the World Health Organization, UNICEF and the Government of Kazakhstan.
astanaDeclaration.intro2: The Declaration reaffirms the commitment of countries worldwide to strengthening primary health care as the foundation of a sustainable health system to achieve universal health coverage and health-related Sustainable Development Goals.
astanaDeclaration.keyProvisionsTitle: Key Provisions of the Astana Declaration:
astanaDeclaration.implementationTitle: Implementation of the Astana Declaration in Kazakhstan:
astanaDeclaration.implementation1: The National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova actively participates in implementing the provisions of the Astana Declaration in Kazakhstan. The Center develops methodological recommendations, conducts research and monitoring, provides expert support in primary health care development in the country.
astanaDeclaration.implementation2: The Center's main work directions within the Astana Declaration implementation include:

astana.title: Astana Branch
astana.description: The Astana branch of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova is the leading regional center in the field of healthcare development. The branch coordinates research activities of medical organizations in the city, implements innovative approaches in healthcare management and provides consultative and methodological assistance to medical organizations of the capital.

almaty.title: Almaty Branch
almaty.description: The Almaty branch of the National Scientific Center for Healthcare Development named after Salidat Kairbekova is a key center for scientific and methodological support of medical organizations in Almaty. The branch carries out expert-analytical activities, conducts educational events and actively participates in the implementation of state programs in healthcare.

shymkent.title: Shymkent Branch
shymkent.description: The Shymkent branch plays an important role in developing the regional healthcare system, providing expert and methodological support to medical organizations.

akmola.title: Akmola Region Branch
akmola.description: The Akmola region branch participates in the implementation of regional healthcare policy and provides support to medical organizations.

aktobe.title: Aktobe Region Branch
aktobe.description: The Aktobe region branch contributes to the development of the regional healthcare system, implementation of innovations and improvement of medical services quality.

almatyRegion.title: Almaty Region Branch
almatyRegion.description: The Almaty region branch provides scientific and methodological support to regional medical organizations and implements healthcare programs.

atyrau.title: Atyrau Region Branch
atyrau.description: The Atyrau region branch focuses on regional healthcare development, improving the quality of medical services and implementing innovative technologies.

east.title: East Kazakhstan Region Branch
east.description: The East Kazakhstan region branch provides comprehensive support to regional medical organizations and contributes to healthcare system modernization.

zhambyl.title: Zhambyl Region Branch
zhambyl.description: The Zhambyl region branch participates in regional healthcare development and improvement of medical services quality.

west.title: West Kazakhstan Region Branch
west.description: The West Kazakhstan region branch contributes to the development of the regional healthcare system and improvement of medical service standards.

karaganda.title: Karaganda Region Branch
karaganda.description: The Karaganda region branch provides methodological support to regional medical organizations and implements healthcare projects.

kostanay.title: Kostanay Region Branch
kostanay.description: The Kostanay region branch participates in improving regional healthcare and enhancing the quality of medical care.

kyzylorda.title: Kyzylorda Region Branch
kyzylorda.description: The Kyzylorda region branch contributes to the development of the regional healthcare system and implementation of innovative practices.

mangistau.title: Mangistau Region Branch
mangistau.description: The Mangistau region branch provides expert and methodological support to regional medical organizations and participates in healthcare policy implementation.

pavlodar.title: Pavlodar Region Branch
pavlodar.description: The Pavlodar region branch contributes to the development of the regional healthcare system and improvement of medical service standards.

north.title: North Kazakhstan Region Branch
north.description: The North Kazakhstan region branch participates in regional healthcare development and improvement of medical services quality.

turkestan.title: Turkestan Region Branch
turkestan.description: The Turkestan region branch provides comprehensive support to regional medical organizations and implements healthcare programs.

ulytau.title: Ulytau Region Branch
ulytau.description: The Ulytau region branch contributes to regional healthcare development and improvement of medical services quality.

zhetisu.title: Zhetisu Region Branch
zhetisu.description: The Zhetisu region branch provides methodological support to regional medical organizations and implements innovations in healthcare.
